decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed rear extension / infill extension, by reason of its depth, height, form and sitting, would be unduly intrusive, resulting in sense of enclosure to the neighbouring occupiers and result in a material loss of light. The proposal would therefore cause harm to neighbouring amenity contrary to London Plan (2021) policies D3 and D4, policy CS.14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and policy DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014)

Reason : 2 - The proposed rear extension / infill extension, by reason of its depth, height, form and sitting, would appear out of keeping with the scale and proportions of the original building, and would appear unduly dominant. The proposal would therefore cause harm to the character and appearance of the building and terrace, contary to London Plan (2021) policies D3 and D4, policy CS.14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and policy DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE 1 - Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required.

Reason : 4 - INFORMATIVE 2 - Refused Drawings
Site Location Plan; Block/Site Plan; SW17DTPP1; SW17DTPP2; SW17DTPP3; SW17DTPP4; SW17DTPP5
